botanical_details.potentially_harmful: All parts may cause severe discomfort if ingested. Wear gloves and other protective equipment when handling
botanical_details.genus: Iris may be rhizomatous or bulbous perennials, with narrow leaves and erect stems bearing flowers with 3 large spreading or pendent fall petals, alternating with 3 erect, often smaller, standard petals, in late winter, spring or early summer
botanical_details.horticultural_group: Standard Dwarf Bearded irises are rhizomatous perennials 20-40cm tall, with flowers 5-7cm across, bearded on the falls, in late spring or early summer

how_to_grow.cultivation: Grow in well-drained, fertile, neutral to slightly acid soil in full sun. See bearded iris cultivation for more detailed advice
how_to_grow.propagation: Propagate by division, see dividing iris for more detailed advice
how_to_grow.pruning: Remove spent flower stems and any dying foliage in autumn
how_to_grow.pests: May be susceptible to slugs, snails and thrips
how_to_grow.diseases: May be susceptible to rhizome rot, leaf spot and other iris diseases, including virus diseases
